oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Death and Plasticity in Clones Influence Invasion Success
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fenollosa, Erola
Roach, Deborah A
Munn√©-Bosch, Sergi
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: theme:invasion success
invasion success
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Although invasion processes have been intensely studied, the mechanisms underlying the success of some invasive clonal species remain a mystery. Using the specific example of Carpobrotus edulis, we illustrate how invasion success can be facilitated by a unique spatiotemporal regulation of growth and senescence of plant parts.
